issue.title: Transition API not working on Android

comment.body: @AndresdoSantos i am having the same issue here... my looping animation with Reanimated works fine in the simulator, but not on my physical device... any updates pls? 🙏🏼

issue.title: 3.0.0-rc.2 Android - TypeError: Cannot read property 'stateNode' of undefined

labels.name: Platform: Android
labels.description: This issue is specific to Android

labels.name: Repro provided
labels.description: A reproduction with a snippet of code, snack or repo is provided

issue.body:
### Description

I'm attempting to use Fabric with 3.0.0-rc.2. iOS works fine however on Android I get the following attempting to render an Animated.View.


```
 ERROR  TypeError: Cannot read property 'stateNode' of undefined

This error is located at:
    in AnimatedComponent(View) (at createAnimatedComponent.tsx:533)
```

### Steps to reproduce

Render an ``<Animated.View/>``

### Snack or a link to a repository

https://github.com/kyle-ssg/reanimated-reproduction

### Reanimated version

3.0.0-rc.2

### React Native version

0.69.5 (I can confirm this also happens on RN 0.70.rc-4)

### Platforms

Android

### JavaScript runtime

JSC

### Workflow

React Native (without Expo)

### Architecture

Fabric (New Architecture)

### Build type

Debug mode

### Device

Android emulator

### Device model

_No response_

### Acknowledgements

Yes

comment.body: If someone is running into similar issue (for me it was property 'version' of undefined) my solution was to modify properly metro.config.js. I had react-native-svg-transformer included in project as well and you need to follow the new way to integrate it on it's official github page.

issue.title: IOS - Could not get BatchedBridge, make sure your bundle is packaged properly

labels.name: Missing repro
labels.description: This issue need minimum repro scenario

labels.name: Platform: iOS
labels.description: This issue is specific to iOS

labels.name: Needs review
labels.description: Issue is ready to be reviewed by a maintainer

labels.name: Missing info
labels.description: The user didn't precise the problem enough

issue.body:
### Description

Since upgrading to version 0.71.14 I had to upgrade Reanimated to version 3.5.4 I was originally running v2. Had to upgrade due to xcode 15 and upgraded reanimated as visionCamera dependency required me to use v3 of reanimated. Since this upgrade I now get the following error on a fresh install of app to real device or even simulator.

"Could not get BatchedBridge, make sure your bundle is packaged properly".

if I downgrade reanimated back to v2 issue goes away. But the dependency vision camera will complain if i don't use the latest version of reanimated (v3)

Worth a note, that when I disable hermes the error goes away.

Anyone have a clue on things I can try? I don't particularly want to disable hermes.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run app using 0.71.14 of react native with reanimated running version 3.5.4
2. Install a fresh build to real iphone or simulator

### Reanimated version

3.5.4

### React Native version

0.71.14

### Platforms

iOS

### JavaScript runtime

None

### Workflow

React Native

### Architecture

None

### Build type

None

### Device

Real device

### Device model

IPhone X

### Acknowledgements

Yes

comment.body:

issue.title: IOS - Could not get BatchedBridge, make sure your bundle is packaged properly

labels.name: Needs review
labels.description: Issue is ready to be reviewed by a maintainer

issue.body:
### Description

Since upgrading to version 0.71.14 I had to upgrade Reanimated to version 3.5.4 I was originally running v2. Had to upgrade due to xcode 15 and upgraded reanimated as visionCamera dependency required me to use v3 of reanimated. Since this upgrade I now get the following error on a fresh install of app to real device or even simulator.

"Could not get BatchedBridge, make sure your bundle is packaged properly".

if I downgrade reanimated back to v2 issue goes away. But the dependency vision camera will complain if i don't use the latest version of reanimated (v3)

Worth a note, that when I disable hermes the error goes away.

Anyone have a clue on things I can try? I don't particularly want to disable hermes.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run app using 0.71.14 of react native with reanimated running version 3.5.4
2. Install a fresh build to real iphone or simulator

### Snack or a link to a repository

.

### Reanimated version

3.5.4

### React Native version

0.71.14

### Platforms

iOS

### JavaScript runtime

None

### Workflow

React Native

### Architecture

None

### Build type

None

### Device

Real device

### Device model

IPhone X

### Acknowledgements

Yes

pull_request.title: Add clamp to mock
pull_request.body:
<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! We appreciate you spending the time to work on these changes. Please follow the template so that the reviewers can easily understand what the code changes affect. -->

## Summary

This PR fixes error `TypeError: (0 , _reactNativeReanimated.clamp) is not a function`.

## Test plan

`jest.mock('react-native-reanimated', () => require('react-native-reanimated/mock'))`

commits.message:

issue.title: "Could not get BatchedBridge, make sure your bundle is packaged correctly" since react-native 0.65 using Release schema

comment.body:
Im getting the same error "Could not get BatchedBridge"

React Native: 0.71.14
React-native-reanimated: 3.5.4

Any ideas how to resolve? I have found that this issue has occurred since updating react native and reanimated to v3 from v2.

Also I discovered that by disabling hermes the error goes away.
